A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Hyperspace-Ramming ruins canon. If followed to its logical conclusion all space combat would be engaged with hyperspace equipped missiles. Also with hyperspace a car-chase theme DOES NOT WORK. Was the first order incapable of jumping half their fleet directly in front of the rebels? Perhaps they were also short on \"hyper-fuel\". And finally the emasculation of Luke Skywalker\, the greatest/most powerful Jedi in Star Wars\, is a slap in the face to the entire Skywalker saga. This movie is mutually exclusive from the rest of the Star Wars universe and should be viewed as no more than an expensive fan fiction
